text.headline: Waterfront Golf
text.text:
The New Manila Bay golf project is a proposed development of a golf course and other amenities in the Manila Bay area of the Philippines. The project is being spearheaded by the Bases Conversion and Development Authority (BCDA) and is expected to cost around 10 billion PHP.

The proposed golf course will be located on a reclaimed area of Manila Bay. In addition to the golf course, the New Manila Bay project will also feature a number of other amenities, including a clubhouse, a spa, a convention center, and a hotel. The project is expected to be completed in 2025 and is expected to generate around 10,000 jobs during construction and 5,000 jobs once it is operational.

The New Manila Bay golf project is part of the BCDA's larger plan to redevelop the Manila Bay area into a world-class tourist destination. The project is expected to boost the tourism industry in the Philippines, generating billions of pesos in revenue for the government. The BCDA has said that the project will be environmentally sustainable and that it will take steps to minimize its impact on the surrounding area. The project is a major development that is expected to have a significant impact on the Philippines. The project is expected to boost the tourism industry, generate jobs, and improve the economy of the country.
